title: Hubble glitch renews talk about private servicing mission
summary: A problem with the Hubble Space Telescope has renewed discussion about whether and how NASA might approve a private mission to reboost and potentially repair the spacecraft.

title: U.S., U.K., Australia sign agreement to jointly operate deep space radar network
summary: As part of the trilateral security partnership known as AUKUS, a network of three space-tracking radars will be set up in Australia, the United Kingdom and the United States.

title: Webb discovers that rocky planets can form in more extreme environments
summary: Using the joint NASA, European Space Agency, and Canadian Space Agency James Webb Space Telescope, a team of scientists has discovered water and other important molecules within the inner, rocky-planet-forming regions of a protoplanetary disk located around a star. However, the star itself is located in one of the most extreme environments in our galaxy — a region wherein massive stars are formed.

title: Air Force Secretary: Military needs AI to augment human capabilities
summary: The U.S. military needs to rapidly adopt artificial intelligence technology to aid in tracking targets, data analysis and managing complex missions, Air Force Secretary Frank Kendall said Dec. 2 at the Reagan National Defense Forum.

title: Canada taps into U.S. military satellites for mobile communications
summary: Canada is the first international partner to access the U.S. Mobile User Objective System (MUOS) satellite network, the U.S. Space Force announced Nov. 30.

title: SpaceX Ready To Test Starlink Direct To Cell Service
summary: In an FCC filing made this week SpaceX is seeking "special temporary authority" to commence testing of there Starlink Direct To Cell service on December 10, with a testing period lasting 180 days.

title: Intelsat To Bring OneWeb Internet To Regional American Airlines Jets
summary: American Airlines has revealed plans to outfit nearly 500 regional jets starting in 2024 with their cutting-edge multi-orbit Wi-Fi connectivity provided by Intelsat.

title: Angola Signs Artemis Accords
summary: Angola officially signed the Artemis Accords on November 30, solidifying its commitment to best practices in space exploration.

title: Angola signs Artemis Accords
summary: Angola signed the U.S.-led Artemis Accords outlining best practices for space exploration Nov. 30, becoming the third African nation to do so.

title: GAO: 2025 Unlikely for First Artemis Lunar Landing, Maybe 2027
summary: The Government Accountability Office’s latest report on NASA’s Artemis program is skeptical that the agency can return astronauts to the lunar surface in 2025, the current plan. If development of […]
